items.title: Awesome Conversational Ai
items.content_text:
### Books and Papers

*   [An Annotated Reading List of Conversational AI](https://medium.com/x8-the-ai-community/a-reading-list-and-mini-survey-of-conversational-ai-32fceea97180) - An annotated list of mostly academic papers on all the topics around Conversational AI. Created in 2018.

### Clients

*   [Messenger](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/messenger-platform/) - Enhance your Facebook Page experience by adding a chatbot through Messenger.
*   [Slack](https://api.slack.com/) - Reach your end users where they work by deploying your chatbot to Slack.

### Conversational UX

*   [Voicebot.ai](https://voicebot.ai/) - Provides in one place the most important news, commentary, research, and analysis of voice technology.

### Natural Language Understanding

*   [Awesome Machine Learning (‚≠ê69k)](https://github.com/josephmisiti/awesome-machine-learning) - A curated list of awesome machine learning frameworks, libraries, and software (by language).
*   [The NLP Index](https://index.quantumstat.com/) - The NLP Index, a free and open-source code discovery tool, houses over 3000+ code repos. It includes the arxiv research paper PDF, ConnectedPapers link, and its GitHub repo.

### Platforms

*   [OpenDialog](https://opendialog.ai/) - OpenDialog enables you to design, develop and deploy conversational applications. Offers an open-source version and an Enterprise edition.
*   [Rasa](https://rasa.com/) - A platform to create virtual assistants at scale. Offers an open-source version and an Enterprise edition.
items.content_html:

items.title: Magictools
items.content_text:
### Graphics / Spritesheet Tools

*   :tada: [EzSpriteSheet (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/z64me/EzSpriteSheet) - Creates sprite sheets from animated GIFs and more

### Engines and Frameworks / Voxel Editors

*   :free: [Cocos Creator](https://www.cocos.com/en/creator) - Cocos Creator, a free cross-platform game development editor supporting Cocos2d-js, helps developers build 2D and 3D game scenes, edit game UI and other game resources quickly and efficiency.
*   :money\_with\_wings: [CopperCube](http://www.ambiera.com/coppercube/) - CopperCube is an all-in-one 3D game engine.Very easy to use.
*   :tada: [Defold](http://www.defold.com/) - Free 2D Game Engine for Cross-Platform Publishing
*   :free: [Lumberyard](https://aws.amazon.com/lumberyard/) - Amazon Lumberyard is a free AAA game engine deeply integrated
*   :tada: [nuklear (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/Immediate-Mode-UI/Nuklear) - A single-header ANSI C immediate mode cross-platform GUI library.
*   :tada: [OpenXRay (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/OpenXRay/xray-16) - a community-modified X-Ray engine used in S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game series.
*   :tada: [Pixel Vision 8 (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/PixelVision8/PixelVision8) - Pixel Vision 8's core philosophy is to teach retro game development with streamlined workflows. PV8 is also a platform that standardizes 8-bit fantasy console limitations built on top of the open-source C# game engine based on MonoGame.

items.title: Awesome Capacitor
items.content_text:
### Official plugins

*   [App (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/app) - Handles high-level App state and events.
*   [Screen Reader (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/screen-reader) - Provides access to TalkBack/VoiceOver/etc. and provides simple text-to-speech capabilities for visual accessibility.

### Community plugins

*   Firebase
    *   [Analytics (‚≠ê168)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/firebase-analytics) - A native plugin for Firebase analytics.
    *   [Crashlytics (‚≠ê74)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/firebase-crashlytics) - Firebase Crashlytics.
    *   [Fcm (‚≠ê258)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/fcm) - Enable Firebase Cloud Messaging features for Capacitor apps.
    *   [Remote config (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/firebase-remote-config) - A native plugin for Firebase remote config.
*   [Photoviewer (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/photoviewer) - PhotoViewer table images with full-screen and sharing capabilities.
*   [Privacy screen (‚≠ê93)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/privacy-screen) - Protects your app from displaying a screenshot in recents screen/App Switcher.
*   [Screen brightness (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/screen-brightness) - Control screen brightness on iOS and android.

### Other plugins

*   [Intent (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/IT-MikeS/capacitor-intents) - Supports multiple broadcast receiving of intents, and sending out BroadcastIntents in Android.
*   [Oauth2 (‚≠ê253)](https://github.com/moberwasserlechner/capacitor-oauth2) - Generic OAuth 2 client plugin. It let you configure the OAuth parameters yourself instead of using SDKs.
*   [Video player (‚≠ê122)](https://github.com/jepiqueau/capacitor-video-player) - Play a video full-screen on IOS, Android, Web and Electron platforms.

items.title: Awesome Nodejs
items.content_text:
### Packages / HTTP

*   [undici (‚≠ê6.9k)](https://github.com/nodejs/undici) - High performance HTTP client written from scratch with zero dependencies.
*   [ky-universal (‚≠ê674)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/ky-universal) - Universal HTTP client based on Fetch.
*   [purest (‚≠ê562)](https://github.com/simov/purest) - REST client.

### Packages / Debugging / Profiling

*   [dats (‚≠ê102)](https://github.com/immobiliare/dats) - Minimalistic and zero-dependencies [StatsD (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/statsd/statsd) client.

### Packages / Web frameworks

*   [Fastify (‚≠ê34k)](https://github.com/fastify/fastify) - Fast and low overhead web framework.
*   [Nuxt.js (‚≠ê58k)](https://github.com/nuxt/nuxt.js) - Minimalistic framework for server-rendered Vue.js apps.
*   [AdonisJs (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/adonisjs/core) - A true MVC framework for Node.js built on solid foundations of Dependency Injection and IoC container.
*   [Moleculer (‚≠ê6.3k)](https://github.com/moleculerjs/moleculer) - Fast & powerful microservices framework.

### Packages / Streams

*   [from2 (‚≠ê132)](https://github.com/hughsk/from2) - Convenience wrapper for ReadableStream, inspired by `through2`.

### Packages / Parsing

*   [@parcel/css (‚≠ê7.1k)](https://github.com/parcel-bundler/parcel-css) - A CSS parser, transformer, and minifier written in Rust.

### Packages / Minifiers

*   [babel-minify (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/babel/minify) - ES2015+ aware minifier based on the Babel toolchain.

items.title: Awesome Esports
items.content_text:
### Libraries / APIs & Web Services

*   [Blizzard.js (‚≠ê147)](https://github.com/benweier/blizzard.js) - A Node.js library for interacting with the Blizzard Community Platform API.
*   [HLTV (‚≠ê443)](https://github.com/gigobyte/HLTV) - A Node.js library for interacting with the HLTV API.
*   [liquipediapy (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/c00kie17/liquipediapy) - A Python library for interacting with the Liquipedia API.
*   [valorant.js (‚≠ê107)](https://github.com/liamcottle/valorant.js) - A Node.js library for interacting with the VALORANT APIs used in game.

### Libraries / Data parsing and analysis

*   [Cassiopeia (‚≠ê560)](https://github.com/meraki-analytics/cassiopeia) - A Python framework for interacting with and analyzing data from the Riot Games League of Legends API.

### Unofficial documentation / Tournaments management

*   [BNETDocs (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/BNETDocs/bnetdocs-web) - A documentation and discussion website for Blizzard and Battle.net protocols.
*   [Rift Explorer (‚≠ê560)](https://github.com/Pupix/rift-explorer) - An automatically generated documentation of Riot Games LCU API.
*   [valorant-api-docs (‚≠ê526)](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs) - An automatically generated documentation of Valorant internal API.

### Applications & Tools / Tournaments management

*   [Esport Team Logos (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/lootmarket/esport-team-logos) - A database of Esports teams logos.
*   [Boltobserv (‚≠ê314)](https://github.com/boltgolt/boltobserv) - An external Counter-Strike: Global Offensive radar for observers.
*   [Open Dota (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/odota/core) - A website for Dota 2 esports stats.

items.title: Awesome Flame
items.content_text:
### Other Articles & Tutorials

*   [Dino Run - Flutter Game Development Series with Flame](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLiZZKL9HLmWOmQgYxWHuOHOWsUUlhCCOY) - An easy to follow tutorial on how to make 2D mobile game in Flutter using Flame engine. By [DevKage](https://www.youtube.com/devkage "DevKage").
*   [Spacescape - Flutter Game Development Series with Flame](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLiZZKL9HLmWPL0URlq9WLng1A_g1LDuxx) - An easy to follow tutorial on how to make 2D mobile game in Flutter using Flame engine. By [DevKage](https://www.youtube.com/devkage "DevKage").

items.title: Vertx Awesome
items.content_text: ### Database Clients * NoSQL Databases * [MongoDB (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/vert-x3/vertx-mongo-client) - An asynchronous client for interacting with a MongoDB database. * [Redis (‚≠ê132)](https://github.com/vert-x3/vertx-redis-client) - Asynchronous API to interact with Redis. * [Cassandra (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/vert-x3/vertx-cassandra-client) - A Vert.x client allowing applications to interact with a Cassandra service. * [Cassandra (‚≠ê39)](https://github.com/englishtown/vertx-cassandra) - Asynchronous API to interact with Cassandra and Cassandra Mapping. * [OrientDB (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/cstamas/vertx-orientdb) - Non-blocking OrientDB server integration. * [Bitsy (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/cstamas/vertx-bitsy) - Non-blocking Bitsy Graph server integration. * [MarkLogic (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/etourdot/vertx-marklogic) - Asynchronous client for Marklogic Database Server. * [SirixDB (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/sirixdb/sirix/tree/master/bundles/sirix-rest-api) - Non-blocking SirixDB HTTP-server. * [DGraph (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/aesteve/vertx-dgraph-client) - An example on how to build a Vert.x gRPC compliant client. Here targeting [dgraph](https://dgraph.io) * [RxFirestore (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/pjgg/rxfirestore) - Non-blocking Firestore SDK written in a reactive way. * [MongoDB (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/imrafaelmerino/vertx-mongo-effect) - Pure functional and reactive MongoDB client on top of [Vert.x Effect (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/imrafaelmerino/vertx-mongo-effect). Full support for retry, fallback and recovery operations. * [Aerospike (‚≠ê31)](https://github.com/dream11/vertx-aerospike-client) - Asynchronous and non-blocking API to interact with Aerospike server. Uses [AerospikeClient's (‚≠ê242)](https://github.com/aerospike/aerospike-client-java) async commands internally and handles the result on the Vert.x Context.
items.content_html:
Database Clients

  • NoSQL Databases
    • MongoDB (‚≠ê61) - An asynchronous client for interacting with a MongoDB database.
    • Redis (‚≠ê132) - Asynchronous API to interact with Redis.
    • Cassandra (‚≠ê33) - A Vert.x client allowing applications to interact with a Cassandra service.
    • Cassandra (‚≠ê39) - Asynchronous API to interact with Cassandra and Cassandra Mapping.
    • OrientDB (‚≠ê7) - Non-blocking OrientDB server integration.
    • Bitsy (‚≠ê1) - Non-blocking Bitsy Graph server integration.
    • MarkLogic (‚≠ê2) - Asynchronous client for Marklogic Database Server.
    • SirixDB (‚≠ê1.2k) - Non-blocking SirixDB HTTP-server.
    • DGraph (‚≠ê1) - An example on how to build a Vert.x gRPC compliant client. Here targeting dgraph
    • RxFirestore (‚≠ê9) - Non-blocking Firestore SDK written in a reactive way.
    • MongoDB (‚≠ê0) - Pure functional and reactive MongoDB client on top of Vert.x Effect (‚≠ê0). Full support for retry, fallback and recovery operations.
    • Aerospike (‚≠ê31) - Asynchronous and non-blocking API to interact with Aerospike server. Uses AerospikeClient's (‚≠ê242) async commands internally and handles the result on the Vert.x Context.

items.title: Awesome Love2d
items.content_text:
### 3D

*   [anim9 (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/excessive/anim9) - 3D skeletal animation library (design to be used with IQM and IQE).
*   [Brinevector3D (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/flamendless/brinevector3D) - FFI-enabled vector library for 3D (x,y,z).
*   [IQE (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/excessive/iqe) - Inter-Quake Export loader (text).
*   [IQM (‚≠ê40)](https://github.com/excessive/iqm-exm) - Inter-Quake Model loader (binary).
*   [love-gltf](https://gitlab.com/Alloyed/love-gltf) - Gltf asset loader and test renderer; Supports skeletal animations and morph targets.
*   [Lovox (‚≠ê53)](https://github.com/tjakka5/Lovox) - Pseudo-3D library for working with voxels.

### AI

*   [Jumper (‚≠ê636)](https://github.com/Yonaba/Jumper) - Grid-based pathfinding library.
*   [Lua-star (‚≠ê75)](https://github.com/wesleywerner/lua-star) - Easy and pure Lua A\* path finding.

### Animation

*   [andross (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/pfirsich/andross) - A Lua library for 2D skeletal/bone animations with a L√∂ve backend.
*   [anim8 (‚≠ê861)](https://github.com/kikito/anim8) - Animation library.
*   [animx (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/YoungNeer/animx) - A featureful Animation library for loading animations from XML files!.
*   [chiro (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/bjornbytes/chiro) - Convenience wrapper around [Spine](http://esotericsoftware.com).
*   [Peachy (‚≠ê109)](https://github.com/josh-perry/peachy) - A parser/renderer for Aseprite animations in L√ñVE.
*   [skeletor (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/pelevesque/skeletor) - 2D skeletal animation system.
*   [Walt (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/davisdude/Walt) - Animation library.
*   [Lump (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/sixFingers/lump) - Adobe Flash animation runtime.
*   [lovanim (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/patrixr/love-animation) - A minimal stateful animation library.
*   [SYSL-Text (‚≠ê103)](https://github.com/SystemLogoff/SYSL-Text) - Text animation and automatic wrapping library based on tags.

### Camera

*   [Brady (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/davisdude/Brady) - Camera library with parallax scrolling.
*   [Editgrid (‚≠ê49)](https://github.com/bakpakin/Editgrid) - Gamera and HUMP compatible scaling grid.
*   [gamera (‚≠ê285)](https://github.com/kikito/gamera) - Camera system.
*   [hump.camera](https://hump.readthedocs.io/en/latest/camera.html) - Camera library with window locking and smooth camera movement interpolation.

### Development

*   [FPSGraph (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/icrawler/FPSGraph) - Small FPS graphing utility.
*   [debugGraph (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/Mechazawa/Love-Debug-Graph) - Small OO FPS graphing utillity based on FPSGraph.
*   [Lovebird (‚≠ê309)](https://github.com/rxi/lovebird) - Browser-based debug console.
*   [lurker (‚≠ê330)](https://github.com/rxi/lurker) - Auto-swaps changed Lua files in a running game.
*   [L√ñVE API (‚≠ê332)](https://github.com/love2d-community/love-api) - The complete API documentation of L√ñVE in a Lua table.
*   [L√ñVE Build (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/nhartland/love-build) - GitHub Action for automated cross-platform builds.
*   [L√ñVE TypeScript Definitions (‚≠ê123)](https://github.com/hazzard993/love-typescript-definitions) - Write L√ñVE games with TypeScript.
*   [lovelier (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/patrixr/lovelier) - A L√ñVE live reloader with Moonscript support.

### Drawing

*   [Artal (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/unXedDani/Artal) - A .PSD parsing library for L√ñVE.
*   [Autobatch (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/rxi/autobatch) - Small L√ñVE module to automate the use of SpriteBatches.
*   [center (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/S-Walrus/center) - A simple module to dynamically align and fit content to screens of any size.
*   [deep (‚≠ê90)](https://github.com/Nikaoto/deep) - Adds Z axis; allows you to queue actions and draw calls.
*   [draft (‚≠ê53)](https://github.com/pelevesque/draft) - A module for drawing complex shapes.
*   [HSLUV (‚≠ê47)](https://github.com/hsluv/hsluv-lua) - Lua implementation of HSLuv (a human-friendly alternative to HSL).
*   [Maid64 (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/adekto/maid64) - Low resolution scaler for L√ñVE.
*   [Push (‚≠ê572)](https://github.com/Ulydev/push) - A simple resolution-handling library for L√ñVE.
*   [renderplanet (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/meric/renderplanet/) - Realistic orthographic planet rendering.
*   [svglover (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/globalcitizen/svglover) - Library to import and display simple SVGs in L√ñVE.
*   [SYSL-Pixel (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/SystemLogoff/Sysl-Pixel) - Pixel art focused scaler for graphics, position, screen-captures and shaders.
*   [S√∂lar (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/JanWerder/soelar) - A fairly simple solar system simulator.
*   [Tove2d (‚≠ê181)](https://github.com/poke1024/tove2d) - Animated vector graphics for L√ñVE.
*   [turtle.lua (‚≠ê100)](https://github.com/arthurealike/turtle.lua) - Turtle graphics library for L√ñVE.
*   [Runtime-TextureAtlas (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/EngineerSmith/Runtime-TextureAtlas) - Texture atlas packer and renderer at runtime; no external tools.
*   [Export-TextureAtlas (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/EngineerSmith/Export-TextureAtlas) - Extends Runtime-TextureAtlas as a commandline tool to export an atlas.

### Entity

*   [adorbs (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/JosephShering/adorbs) - Minimal, Functional Entity Component System.
*   [Concord (‚≠ê281)](https://github.com/Tjakka5/Concord) - A feature-complete ECS library.
*   [knife.system (‚≠ê485)](https://github.com/airstruck/knife/blob/master/readme/system.md) - Minimalist functional ECS.
*   [nata (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/tesselode/nata) - Hybrid OOP/ECS entity management.
*   [tiny-ecs (‚≠ê740)](https://github.com/bakpakin/tiny-ecs) - Entity Component System for Lua that's simple, flexible, and useful.

### Helpers

*   [astray (‚≠ê165)](https://github.com/SiENcE/astray) - Astray is a lua based maze, room and dungeon generation library for dungeon crawlers and roguelike video games.
*   [batteries (‚≠ê409)](https://github.com/1bardesign/batteries/) - Fills out lua's sparse standard library and provides implementations of common algorithms and data structures useful for games.
*   [clove (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/YoungNeer/clove) - A helper library which allows you to quickly loads huge amount of assets.
*   [iffy (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/YoungNeer/iffy) - A SpriteSheet and Tileset helper library for L√ñVE.
*   [knife (‚≠ê485)](https://github.com/airstruck/knife) - Collection of useful micro-modules for Lua (Class, State Machines, Bind, Chain, Coroutines, Event, Memoize, Entity, Tests, Timer).
*   [shard (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/MineGame159/shard) - Collection of useful mini modules.
*   [love-state-switcher (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/nekromoff/love-state-switcher) - State switcher class for Lua L√ñVE Engine.
*   [lue (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/Ulydev/lue) - Lue is a L√ñVE library that allows you to display hue color effects in your game.
*   [lume (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/rxi/lume/) - Collection of functions for Lua, geared towards game development.
*   [narrator (‚≠ê149)](https://github.com/astrochili/narrator) - An Ink narrative scripting language parser and runtime implementation.
*   [reflowprint (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/josefnpat/reflowprint) - A library designed for alignment of text that is shown one character at a time.
*   [roomy (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/tesselode/roomy) - Screen management library for L√ñVE.
*   [rotLove (‚≠ê280)](https://github.com/paulofmandown/rotLove) - Roguelike Toolkit in L√ñVE. A L√ñVE/lua port of rot.js.
*   [ScreenManager (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/rm-code/screenmanager) - Screen/State Management for the L√ñVE framework.
*   [shack (‚≠ê65)](https://github.com/Ulydev/shack) - Shack is a L√ñVE library that lets you easily add screen effects such as shake and rotation.
*   [Simple Tiled Implementation (‚≠ê967)](https://github.com/karai17/Simple-Tiled-Implementation) - Tiled map loader and renderer.
*   [Vivid (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/WetDesertRock/vivid) - Color math, manipulation and conversion library.
*   [Yonder (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/thenerdie/Yonder) - A ridiculously easy to use game state management library for LOVE2D.

### Input

*   [baton (‚≠ê241)](https://github.com/tesselode/baton) -  Input library for L√ñVE that bridges the gap between keyboard and gamepad controls.
*   [love-microphone (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/LPGhatguy/love-microphone) - Simple microphone support for L√ñVE.
*   [LoveKeys (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/SpaceCat-Chan/LoveKeys) - A simple input handeling library that keeps track of things for you.
*   [tactile (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/tesselode/tactile) - A straightforward and flexible input library.

### Lighting

*   [lighter (‚≠ê41)](https://github.com/speakk/lighter) - A performant dynamic light implementation with a simple API.
*   [Sh√§dows (‚≠ê178)](https://github.com/matiasah/shadows) - A Shadows & Lights engine for L√ñVE.
*   [Light World (‚≠ê238)](https://github.com/tanema/light_world.lua) - A lighting model.
*   [Simple Love Lights (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/dylhunn/simple-love-lights) - A very simple raycasting light implementation.
*   [Light (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/xiejiangzhi/light) - A simple dynamic light implementation.

### Math

*   [Bresenham (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/rm-code/Bresenham) - Bresenham's line algorithm written in Lua.
*   [brinevector (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/novemberisms/brinevector) - Standalone lightweight luajit ffi-accelerated 2D vector library for great performance.
*   [Cirno's Perfect Math Library (‚≠ê319)](https://github.com/excessive/cpml) - Math/intersection library designed for games.
*   [delaunay (‚≠ê109)](https://github.com/Yonaba/delaunay) - Delaunay triangulation for convex polygons.
*   [hump.vector](https://hump.readthedocs.io/en/latest/vector.html) - Powerful 2D vector class.
*   [MLib (‚≠ê89)](https://github.com/davisdude/mlib) - Math and shape-intersection detection library written in Lua. It's aim is to be robust and easy to use.
*   [nvec (‚≠ê54)](https://github.com/MikuAuahDark/NPad93/blob/master/nvec.lua) - Hump.vector-compatible LuaJIT FFI-accelerated 2D vector library.
*   [shash (‚≠ê76)](https://github.com/rxi/shash) - A simple, lightweight spatial hash for Lua.
*   [vector.lua (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/themousery/vector.lua) - A simple vector library based on the PVector class from processing.

### Music

*   [denver (‚≠ê88)](https://github.com/superzazu/denver.lua) - A L√∂ve custom waveform generation library.
*   [lovebpm (‚≠ê90)](https://github.com/rxi/lovebpm) - A L√ñVE library for syncing events to the BPM of an audio track.
*   [ripple (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/tesselode/ripple) - An audio manager with tagging support.
*   [wave (‚≠ê96)](https://github.com/Ulydev/wave) - A sound manager with audio parsing and rhythm functionalities.

### Networking

*   [Grease (‚≠ê114)](https://github.com/bartbes/love-misc-libs/tree/master/grease) - Networking library intended to make networking easy for lovers (TCP, UDP, Enet).  (IPv6)
*   [LoverNet (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/josefnpat/LoverNet) - A networking library that leverages bitser and enet. (IPv4)
*   [NoobHub (‚≠ê345)](https://github.com/Overtorment/NoobHub) - OpenSource multiplayer and network messaging. (IPv6)
*   [Sock.lua (‚≠ê180)](https://github.com/camchenry/sock.lua) - A Lua networking library for L√ñVE games. (IPv4)
*   [l√∂ve-ws (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/holywyvern/love-ws) - A websocket client and server library.
*   [love2d-lua-websocket (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/flaribbit/love2d-lua-websocket) - A simple event-driven websocket client library. (IPv4)

### OO

*   [30log (‚≠ê477)](https://github.com/Yonaba/30log) - Minified framework for object-orientation in Lua. It features named (and unnamed) classes, single inheritance and a basic support for mixins.
*   [classic (‚≠ê961)](https://github.com/rxi/classic/) - Tiny class module for Lua. Attempts to stay simple and provide decent performance by avoiding unnecessary over-abstraction.
*   [hump.class](https://hump.readthedocs.io/en/latest/class.html) - Small, fast class/prototype implementation with multiple inheritance (class-commons).
*   [middleclass (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/kikito/middleclass) - Simple OOP library for Lua; has inheritance, metamethods (operators), class variables and weak mixin support (class-commons).
*   [muun (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/megagrump/muun) - Moonscript compatible class implementation.
*   [selene (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/novafacing/selene) - Project template for writing games in Moonscript instead of Lua without precompiling.

### Performance

*   [jprof (‚≠ê99)](https://github.com/pfirsich/jprof) - Profiling library/tool for L√ñVE.
*   [Piefiller (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/Polynominal/Piefiller) - Graphical profiler for L√ñVE.
*   [ProFi](https://gist.github.com/rm-code/383c98a6af04652ed9f39b7ae536bcc5) - A simple lua profiler that works with LuaJIT and prints a pretty report file in columns.

### Physics

*   [breezefield (‚≠ê104)](https://github.com/HDictus/breezefield) - A lightweight and easy love.physics wrapper (windfield alternative).
*   [Bump (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/kikito/bump.lua) - Collision detection library for Lua.
*   [HC](https://hc.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) - Collision detection with arbitrary polygons; allows rotation of objects.
*   [Strike (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/Aweptimum/Strike) - 2D collision detection library. Extendable, based on Separating-Axis-Theorem.

### Platforms

*   [LoveDos (‚≠ê688)](https://github.com/rxi/lovedos) - A Lua framework for 2D DOS games, implementing a subset of the L√ñVE API.
*   [LoveFTW](https://bitbucket.org/T-BoneISS/l-veftw) - Work-in-progress port to Windows phone 8.1.
*   [LOVE-WrapLua (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/LukeZGD/LOVE-WrapLua) - A small and simple wrapper for OneLua, lpp-vita, and Lua Player PS3.
*   [Love.js (‚≠ê736)](https://github.com/Davidobot/love.js) - L√ñVE ported to the web using Emscripten.
*   [L√ñVR (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/bjornbytes/lovr) - L√ñVE for virtual reality devices.

### Publishing

*   [Love-Snap-Template (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/popey/love-snap-template) - A template for packaging L√ñVE games for distribution in the Snappy Store.
*   [AppImageKit (‚≠ê9.1k)](https://github.com/AppImage/AppImageKit) - Using AppImageKit you can package L√ñVE games as AppImages that run on common Linux-based operating systems, such as RHEL, CentOS, Ubuntu, Fedora, debian and derivatives; one game = one file.

### Serialization

*   [arson (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/flamendless/arson.lua) - Companion library for registering custom data types that can be encoded and decoded by json.lua.

  • i18n (‚≠ê26) - Internationalization library designed to help localize your game.
  • Ini Parser (‚≠ê16) - General purpose ini configuration parser.
  • log.lua (‚≠ê333) - Library for configurable log output.
  • love-loader (‚≠ê141) - Threaded resource loading.
  • love2d-assets-loader (‚≠ê40) - Assets Loader.
  • love-pe (‚≠ê19) - A tool made in L√ñVE for changing L√ñVE icon itself.
  • lovely-engine (‚≠ê10) - A tool that makes setting up and using L√ñVE easier and with Moonscript support.
  • Lily (‚≠ê110) - Async Asset Loader.
  • luasteam (‚≠ê185) - Lua bindings for the Steamworks API.
  • Luvent (‚≠ê80) - Simple event-driven programming.
  • nativefiledialog (‚≠ê18) - Open a file picker on Windows/Mac/Linux.
  • ParticleEditor (‚≠ê3) - An editor of particle for L√ñVE.
  • particle-system-playground (‚≠ê14) - A basic L√ñVE particle system editor.
  • require.lua (‚≠ê11) - Require all files in a folder.
  • splashy (‚≠ê41) - Splash Screen Library.
  • ShakeDetectorLua (‚≠ê7) - Uses accelerometer data for shake device detection written in Lua.
  • tick (‚≠ê91) - Useful timing tweaks for L√ñVE's run loop.

Tutorials

  • learn2love - Book for learning programming with Lua and L√ñVE (Version 11.0+).
  • Using Tiled Maps in L√ñVE - An article about using maps created with Tiled in your L√ñVE game.
  • Tutorial on making an Arkanoid-type game (‚≠ê215) - A complete tutorial on how to make a breakout clone by nooowaay.
  • Simple Game Tutorials - Tutorials for making simple games with L√ñVE (Snake, Sokoban, Tetris, etc.).
  • How to L√ñVE - A book by Sheepolution teaching L√ñVE from the ground up.
  • CS50 Introduction to Game Development - Harvard Colleges CS50 OpenCourseWare.
  • Building love2d games for the web with love.js and Docker - A tutorial on packaging L√ñVE games for the web.

IDEs

  • Brackets - A modern, open source text editor by Adobe (obsolete).
    • Lua Syntax Highlighter (‚≠ê4) - Add Lua syntax highlighting in Brackets.
    • L√ñVE Hints for Brackets.io - Provides L√ñVE code hints.
    • Run L√ñVE (‚≠ê4) - Run L√ñVE projects with a hotkey.
  • IntelliJ IDEA - Capable and Ergonomic Java IDE.
    • EmmyLua (‚≠ê680) - Lua IDE/Debugger Plugin for VSCode.
    • L√ñVE IDEA (‚≠ê60) - Snippets and code completion for IntelliJ-IDEA.
  • Vim - Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to make creating and changing any kind of text very efficient.
    • Vim LOVE Docs (‚≠ê56) - Syntax highlighting for Vim.
  • Notepad++ - Notepad++ is a free source code editor and Notepad replacement that supports several languages.
    • L√ñVE API for Notepad++ (‚≠ê12) - Code completion and documentation for Notepad++.

Distribution

  • love-export (‚≠ê54) - Fast and simple command-line tool that builds binaries for you. Supports Windows, macOS, and Linux.
  • love-deploy (‚≠ê13) - Build and deploy games on itch.io (supports windows and web exports).

Related

  • awesome-lua (‚≠ê4.2k) - A list like this one, but more general and encompassing all of Lua's uses.
  • awesome-love-shaders (‚≠ê91) - A collection of shaders designed to work in L√ñVE.
  • awesome-pico8 (‚≠ê2.8k) - A curated list of PICO-8 resources, tutorials, tools and more.

items.title: Awesome Cytodata
items.content_text:
### Datasets / Raw Images

*   [Human Protein Atlas](https://www.proteinatlas.org/humanproteome/subcellular) - Among other assays, the HPA performed confocal imaging of displaying the location of more than 2/3 of human proteins in cell lines. [Raw images (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/CellProfiling/HPA-competition#script-to-download-hpav18) or [infered protein subcellular locations](https://www.proteinatlas.org/about/download) can be downloaded.

### Publications / Collections

*   [Deep learning in microscopy](https://www.nature.com/collections/cfcdjceech) - A collection of review and research articles published in Nature Methods related to multiple use cases of deep learning, including noise reduction, segmentation, tracking and representation learning.
*   [High-Content Imaging and Informatics](https://journals.sagepub.com/toc/jbxb/25/7) - A collection of high-content imaging method and application articles published in SLAS Discovery.
